Yes, many countries have been modifying their animal welfare laws in recent years to better protect animals. Some have even recognized animals as sentient beings, meaning that they are capable of experiencing emotions and sensations such as pain, pleasure, and stress. This recognition has led to increased protections and more robust animal welfare laws.

Additionally, advocacy groups and animal welfare organizations have been working hard to promote and strengthen animal welfare laws. They have raised awareness about the importance of animal welfare through public education campaigns, lobbying, and other initiatives. Furthermore, courts around the world are starting to recognize that animals have rights and that they deserve protection under the law.

While there is still much work to be done, the evolution of animal welfare laws and attitudes towards animals is a positive sign that humans are becoming more aware of the importance of treating animals with respect and compassion.
